00052 #ifndef __UIP_ARP_H__
00053 #define __UIP_ARP_H__
00054 
00055 #include "uip.h"
00056 
00057 
00058 extern struct uip_eth_addr uip_ethaddr;
00059 
00063 #ifdef __ICCARM__
00064         #pragma pack(1)
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 #if defined ( __CC_ARM   )
00068 __packed
00069 #elif defined   (  __GNUC__  )
00070 __attribute__ ((__packed__))
00071 #endif
00072 struct uip_eth_hdr {
00073   struct uip_eth_addr dest;
00074   struct uip_eth_addr src;
00075   u16_t type;
00076 }/*PACK_STRUCT_END*/;
00077 
00078 #ifdef __ICCARM__
00079         #pragma pack()
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 #define UIP_ETHTYPE_ARP 0x0806
00083 #define UIP_ETHTYPE_IP  0x0800
00084 #define UIP_ETHTYPE_IP6 0x86dd
00085 
00086 
00087 /* The uip_arp_init() function must be called before any of the other
00088    ARP functions. */
00089 void uip_arp_init(void);
00090 
00091 /* The uip_arp_ipin() function should be called whenever an IP packet
00092    arrives from the Ethernet. This function refreshes the ARP table or
00093    inserts a new mapping if none exists. The function assumes that an
00094    IP packet with an Ethernet header is present in the uip_buf buffer
00095    and that the length of the packet is in the uip_len variable. */
00096 void uip_arp_ipin(void);
00097 //#define uip_arp_ipin()
00098 
00099 /* The uip_arp_arpin() should be called when an ARP packet is received
00100    by the Ethernet driver. This function also assumes that the
00101    Ethernet frame is present in the uip_buf buffer. When the
00102    uip_arp_arpin() function returns, the contents of the uip_buf
00103    buffer should be sent out on the Ethernet if the uip_len variable
00104    is > 0. */
00105 void uip_arp_arpin(void);
00106 
00107 /* The uip_arp_out() function should be called when an IP packet
00108    should be sent out on the Ethernet. This function creates an
00109    Ethernet header before the IP header in the uip_buf buffer. The
00110    Ethernet header will have the correct Ethernet MAC destination
00111    address filled in if an ARP table entry for the destination IP
00112    address (or the IP address of the default router) is present. If no
00113    such table entry is found, the IP packet is overwritten with an ARP
00114    request and we rely on TCP to retransmit the packet that was
00115    overwritten. In any case, the uip_len variable holds the length of
00116    the Ethernet frame that should be transmitted. */
00117 void uip_arp_out(void);
00118 
00119 /* The uip_arp_timer() function should be called every ten seconds. It
00120    is responsible for flushing old entries in the ARP table. */
00121 void uip_arp_timer(void);
00122 
00147 #define uip_setethaddr(eaddr) do {uip_ethaddr.addr[0] = eaddr.addr[0]; \
00148                               uip_ethaddr.addr[1] = eaddr.addr[1];\
00149                               uip_ethaddr.addr[2] = eaddr.addr[2];\
00150                               uip_ethaddr.addr[3] = eaddr.addr[3];\
00151                               uip_ethaddr.addr[4] = eaddr.addr[4];\
00152                               uip_ethaddr.addr[5] = eaddr.addr[5];} while(0)
00153 
00157 #endif /* __UIP_ARP_H__ */
